com.itko.lisa.test

Interface CompanionInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.model.IWriteXML, NamedType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompanionBase, SimpleCompanion

    public interface CompanionInterface
extends NamedType, com.itko.lisa.model.IWriteXML
    Companions are used to do any kind of per-test execution initialization and cleanup that you might need. LISA has implementations of Companions for HTML ICEBrowser selection and HTTP Bandwidth configuration, for example. This might look a bit like just another hook into the TEST_STARTED and TEST_ENDED events, but the 2 biggest differences are 1) they are given a reference to the actual TestExec object itself, thereby getting an opportunity to modify the test before it starts or perform any additional post-execution logic desired, and 2) these classes are executed local to the Simulator instance running this individual test b/c the TestExec object is not Serializable.

    To define a Companion to use in a test, declare it with an Element that looks like this: 

     <Companion> type="com.itko.lisa.test.BrowserSelection">
    After the above, the Companion of the given type will read whatever XML it needs to initialize itself (see the BrowserSelection Companion for an example of this). Of course, then finally close the Element with </Companion>

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String COMPANION_TAG
      The constant for the tag name for every companion you define in XML
      static java.lang.String TYPE_TAG
      The constant for the type attribute of the Companion tag to determine what kind of Companion you want

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
                throws TestDefException
        This method is called during the construction of a Companion. Once the Companion type tag has been processed, the XML Element is passed to this method for custom XML tag processing.
        Parameters:
        e - is the XML DOM for the Filter
        Throws:
        TestDefException

      • initialize

        void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element e,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> launchState)
                throws TestDefException
        This method is called during the construction of a Companion. Once the Companion type tag has been processed, the XML Element is passed to this method for custom XML tag processing.
        Parameters:
        e - is the XML DOM for the Filter
        launchState - the launch state of the test case, so that these properties can be parsed. For example, the launchState contains the value of the keyLISA_TC_PATH.
        Throws:
        TestDefException

      • testStarting

        void testStarting(TestExec ts)
                  throws TestRunException
        This method is called by LISA after the TestCase has been loaded and the state object for the given test execution has been initialized, but before the test has begun.

        This is your opporunity to contribute to the TestCase setup. For example, you might need to modify state based on some randomization among a set (which is what the BrowserSelection Companion does).

        Parameters:
        ts - is the TestExec (test execution object) that holds the current state.

        Throws:
        TestRunException - when you need to report some kind of fatal error that should halt test execution

        See Also:
        TestExec

      • testEnded

        void testEnded(TestExec ts)
               throws TestRunException
        Thisi is the mirror of the testStarted method; the Test has completed execution, including sending the final event that would normally be sent to all the TestEvent listeners. If you have constructed something at testStarted(), now would be a good time to release it.
        Parameters:
        ts - is the TestExec object for the test that just ended
        Throws:
        TestRunException - when you want the world to know something terribly wrong has happened.

      • getCustomParams

        java.lang.Object getCustomParams()
        This method shows if this particular companion require some custom settings to migrate it to a companion controller. It defaults to false, so CompanionController can perform the regular migration of adding the Companion as customParams. Otherwise, an editor would be initialized to perform the custom steps. When a native Test Case XML document is loaded, a mechanism is needed to migrate the actual CompanionInterface object into Editor objects that will read their state and allow them to be edited and saved. This method gets called on you when a Companion of your type has been found in the Test Case. You should query your Companion for its unique attributes and store them into the CompanionController.params (an opaque Object). NOTE: Don't store your attributes into this class!!!!!!! This editor class will have already been given the right CompanionController object via a call to setNodeInfo(). Store the subclass-specific state there.
